member_organisations:
Current members as of 09/11/2018 are the following stud book passport issuing organisations in the UK, but this list is growing daily: 
 
Sport Horse Breeding of Great Britain 
National Pony Society 
Dartmoor Pony Society 
Traditional Gypsy Cob Association 
Weatherbys  
New Forest Pony Breeding and Cattle Society 
The Appaloosa Horse Club UK 
British Palomino Society 
Donkey Breed |Society 
Exmoor Pony Society 
United Saddlebred Association UK 
British Association for the Purebred Spanish Horse 
British Connemara Society
eu_initiatives: All EU initiatives, policies and legislative files relating to any part of the equestrian industry, particularly those relating to equine passports, zootechnics, the Animal Health Law and the Tripartite Agreement.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Equine Sector Council of the UK (soon to be renamed the British Horse Council) 
 
National Equine Welfare Council of the UK
relevant_communication: The 826ESA is a member of the UK Equine Sector Council (about to be renamed the British Horse Council) which is the main way in which DEFRA consults with the equine industry in the UK. However, as the organisation was only officially formed in February 2018 it has yet to be actively  involved in policy making although both its Equine Legislation Monitoring Sub-Committee and its Welfare Sub-Committee are already actively monitoring developments that relate to them and report back to the full ESA826 member meetings every 6 months.
goals__remit: The 826 Equine Studbooks Association represents the equine studbook passport issuing organisations in the UK currently recognised by DEFRA. Its primary role is to scrutinise all proposed and current EU regulations and UK laws, regulations and Codes of Practice relating to equidae that affects the equestrian industry in the UK, Europe and the wider world. It also has a watching brief on equine welfare matters as they relate to the equestrian breeding and production industry.
